userStories.title: Fix MCP Tool Type Patterns (3 files)
userStories.description:
Three MCP tool files use the wrong type pattern and fail `deno task check`. Fix them to match the correct pattern used by working tools like src/mcp/tools/get-announcements.ts and src/mcp/tools/get-calendar-events.ts.

Files to fix:
- src/mcp/tools/get-all-students-status.ts
- src/mcp/tools/get-feedback.ts
- src/mcp/tools/get-people.ts

All three have the SAME errors:
1. Import `type { Tool }` — but `Tool` does not exist in ../types.ts. Change to: `import { jsonResponse, type ToolDefinition } from "../types.ts";`
2. Schema is wrapped in `z.object({...})` — should be a plain object of Zod types (no z.object wrapper). Change from `export const schema = z.object({ ... })` to `export const schema = { ... }`
3. Property name `inputSchema: schema` — should be just `schema,`
4. Type annotation uses `Tool` — should be `ToolDefinition<typeof schema>`
5. Handler uses `async (args) => { const params = schema.parse(args); ... }` — should destructure args directly: `async ({ param1, param2 }) => { ... }`
6. Handler returns `{ content: [{ type: "text" as const, text: JSON.stringify(...) }] }` — should use `return jsonResponse(data);`
7. Missing `annotations: { readOnlyHint: true, openWorldHint: true }` property

Reference the working pattern in src/mcp/tools/get-announcements.ts or src/mcp/tools/get-calendar-events.ts. After fixing, run `deno task check` to verify zero type errors. Also run `deno task lint` and `deno task fmt`.

userStories.title: Fix Feedback Service Import & People Command Type
userStories.description:
Two files have type errors that fail `deno task check`. Fix them:

1. src/services/feedback.ts (line 11):
   - Currently: `import { listSubmissions, resolveUserId } from "../api/users.ts";`
   - Problem: `listSubmissions` is NOT exported from ../api/users.ts. It is exported from ../api/submissions.ts.
   - Fix: Split into two imports:
     `import { listSubmissions } from "../api/submissions.ts";`
     `import { resolveUserId } from "../api/users.ts";`
   - This will also fix the implicit `any` errors on `sub` and `comment` variables in the same file, since the Submission type will now be properly resolved.

2. src/commands/people.ts (line 40):
   - Currently: `p.courses.map((c) => c.name).join(", ")`
   - Problem: `c` has implicit `any` type because the PersonItem type's courses field needs to be inferred.
   - Fix: Add type annotation: `p.courses.map((c: { id: number; name: string }) => c.name).join(", ")` OR import PersonItem from services/types.ts and type the rowMapper parameter.

After fixing, run `deno task check` to verify zero type errors. Also run `deno task lint` and `deno task fmt`.
